Overview.Summary: The 2016 Transnistrian presidential election resulted in a victory for Vadim Krasnoselsky (1,6). He defeated incumbent President Yevgeny Shevchuk (1). Krasnoselsky was born in 1970 in the Chita region of the RSFSR and served in the Transnistrian military (2,4,8,10). He was previously the Minister of Internal Affairs and is now the Minister of Foreign Affairs (6,7,9).

Timeline.Text: Vadim Krasnoselsky wins the Transnistrian presidential election, defeating incumbent President Yevgeny Shevchuk.
Vadim Krasnoselsky is identified as the winner of the Transnistrian presidential election and is described as having a military background.
Vadim Krasnoselsky's win is confirmed and he is described as a Russian and Romanian politician.
A file of Vadim Krasnoselsky is uploaded to Wikimedia Commons.
Vadim Krasnoselsky meets with Deputy Prime Minister Dmitry Rogozin in Moscow.
Vitaly Ignatiev is appointed as Minister of Foreign Affairs and Chief Negotiator for the Tiraspol-Chisinau negotiating process by Vadim Krasnoselsky.

Overview.Summary: The 2016 Transnistrian presidential election was held on December 11, 2016 (2,3,4,5,6). The winner was pro-Russian politician Igor Dodon (1), who won 52.2% of the vote (1). The election was not recognized by Chisinau (3) and faced a runoff on November 13 (7). Over 2,500 Moldovan citizens from Transnistrian region participated in the election (8). The election was valid with a turnout of over 25% (5,8).

Vadim Krasnoselsky wins the Transnistrian presidential election in the first round.

Overview.Summary: The 2016 Transnistrian presidential election was held on December 11, 2016 (1,2). Vadim Krasnoselsky, who resigned as head of the region's "Supreme Council," defeated incumbent President Yevgeny Shevchuk (1,4,16). The election was declared illegal by Moldova (4). Krasnoselsky's victory was seen as a win for Russia, as he had been endorsed by Moscow (7,16). The result was also seen as a blow to Moldova's pro-European Union government (6,15). The election was not recognized by the international community, including the United States (4,19). Krasnoselsky's victory sparked a cabinet reshuffle, with Vitaly Ignatiev being appointed as Minister of Foreign Affairs (18). The election was seen as a key moment in Transnistrian politics, with the region facing economic challenges and a blockade by Ukraine and Moldova (15).
